title: Evaluate --continue session resumption logic
description: Full audit of --continue / --resume CLI logic. Check: session loading, message replay, working_dir restoration, model/provider preservation, edge cases (deleted session, corrupted DB, session from different dir). Compare with Claude Code's session resume behavior.

logs.msg: Audit complete. Key findings: (1) --continue is globally scoped, should filter by cwd like Claude Code. (2) no_sandbox not persisted â€” silently downgrades on resume. (3) Provider not stored, only model name. (4) No working dir validation on load. (5) Session picker doesn't show directory. See code-explorer audit for full details with file:line refs.

Fixed all 4 issues: (1) --continue scoped to cwd via list_recent_for_dir, (2) provider persisted in schema v3, restored on load with user-visible warnings, (3) session picker shows working dir hint, (4) warns when session dir missing. Review findings also fixed: migration guard hardcoded, path boundary check, deduplicated query, tests added.
